system.biography:
TitleFFF 321-1 Miner
Birthday21 Navek 671
AppearanceAge 48, height 5’10”, heavy frame, weight 176 lb, plain appearance, fair complexion, black hair (graying), green eyes.
Medical/PsycheParasites (worms & fleas)
Size7
ArmorPlain heavy cloth long-sleeved tunic and leggings, cowl and hood; leather belt and calf boots; club and dagger. Add plate half-helm, leather vest, round shield, spear, and short sword if he has time to prepare.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box, shovel, pick, lantern
Valuables61d in coin
Notes

Biography

Odell was not born into a mining family. He is the son of a shepherd and hates sheep with a passion. After badgering his father to train him to be a yeoman (LF) in the family tradition, Odell trained relentlessly. At the age of 18, he was selected to accompany the lord on the next shire muster, where he discovered that there was a mine just a few leagues away. Odell slipped away in the night and made his way to the mine where he declared to the master, “I want to be a miner.” Thirty years later, he wil admit that was the dumbest thing he ever did. Mining is hard and brutal work, but he had burned his bridges and had nowhere else to go.

Over the years, Odell has slowly worked his way up from apprentice to journeyman and then to foreman. His old master died eight years ago and the guild decided to finally make him a master. He is a decent miner, if not especially talented. His rise was aided more by his fighting skills, especially his skill with club and staff, and a distur ing willingness to use them.

As a master, Odell drives his men hard but is fair and reasonably honest, at least with other miners. Since the mine near his home manor is now played out, he has recently been on the move, working at mines across Hârn. He has been more focused on prospecting, as the guild is always looking for new deposits to work. Since the arrival of miners is rarely taken well by local manor lords, the guild felt it would be best to send someone who was not easily intimidated. Odell can most often be found in the company of a couple of journeymen and half a dozen apprentices, with pack mules and perhaps an archer or two if they expect trouble.

Adventure Hooks

We Need To Stick Together. Odell and his men encounter the PCs in the wilderness. There are signs of gargun about. The master miner recommends they travel together for safety until their paths diverge. He is a tough old codger with the ability to spot danger.

I Am Building A Mine Here. The PCs discover a group of miners have set up camp on their (or their master’s) land. Odell is bound and determined to start a new mine, probably destroying everything around it. He will not listen to reason. He must be dealt with.

Temporary Employment. The mining business has been tough lately. Odell is temporarily out of work. When necessary, he falls back on his fighting skills to earn some coin. Despite his age, he is as tough as shoe leather and would make a good sergeant for a band of adventurers heading off into the wilderness.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
